H0.text: Igneous is the type of rock formed when particles are compacted and cemented together.

H1.text: Metallic is the type of rock formed when particles are compacted and cemented together.

H2.text: Metamorphic is the type of rock formed when particles are compacted and cemented together.

H3.text: Sedimentary is the type of rock that is formed when particles are compacted and cemented together.

A4.text: Sedimentary rocks are types of rock formed by the cementation of sediments—i.e. particles made of minerals (geological detritus) or organic matter (biological detritus)—that have been accumulated or deposited at Earth's surface.
